content.match_overview: The Champions League Round of 16 second leg sees Atlético Madrid host Real Madrid at the Metropolitano Stadium, trailing 2-1 on aggregate. Atlético's recent form (WDWLL) includes back-to-back losses for the first time this season, but they remain formidable at home with just one defeat in 24 home matches across all competitions [1][3]. Real Madrid (WWLWW) have lost once in their last 10 games and boast a perfect UCL away record this season (3 wins, 9 goals scored) [5][6]. Historically, Atlético have won 3 of the last 6 derbies at this venue [1], and 7 of the last 10 H2Hs saw both teams score [13].

team_news.raw: Real Madrid's attacking trio Vinícius Júnior (toe), Jude Bellingham (thigh), and Rodrygo (hand) trained normally and are cleared to start despite minor knocks [2][6]. Atlético's Rodrigo de Paul remains a doubt after being subbed at halftime in their weekend defeat [9]. Jan Oblak (1.15 xGA/90) anchors Atlético's defense, while Thibaut Courtois returns for Real after being rested domestically [7][8].

home.projected_xi: 3-5-2: Oblak; Witsel, Giménez, Hermoso; Llorente, Barrios, Koke, Saúl, Lino; Griezmann, Morata

away.projected_xi: 4-3-1-2: Courtois; Vázquez, Rüdiger, Nacho, Mendy; Valverde, Tchouaméni, Kroos; Bellingham; Vinícius, Rodrygo

asian_handicap_analysis.analysis: With Real Madrid needing only a draw, the Asian handicap market presents value in Atlético +0.25 @ 1.95. Simeone's side have covered this line in 70% of home games [14], while Real failed to win 4 of their last 5 UCL away knockout matches by >1 goal [5]. Atlético's 1.74 xG/home game suggests they can outperform their implied probability of 45% [3][14].
asian_handicap_analysis.raw: The -0.25 line on Real Madrid (2.10) underestimates Atlético's home xG superiority (+0.57 xG differential vs Real's away -0.31) [3][14]. Since 2023, 6 of 8 UCL home underdogs +0.25 covered against Spanish opponents.

key_player_matchups.title: Antoine Griezmann vs Aurélien Tchouaméni
key_player_matchups.content: Griezmann's 0.48 xG/90 in UCL matches Tchouaméni's 1.3 tackles/90. The Frenchman's diagonal runs into Rüdiger's zone (1.7 aerials won/90) could exploit Real's right-center weakness [8][15].
key_player_matchups.raw: Griezmann has 3 goals in last 5 derbies – all coming when drifting left to target slower CBs [13]

key_player_matchups.title: Jude Bellingham vs Koke
key_player_matchups.content: Bellingham's 4.3 progressive carries/90 faces Koke's 2.1 interceptions/90. His late-arriving runs into Atlético's 3-5-2 gap could decide tight games [6][15].
key_player_matchups.raw: In first legs without Bellingham, Real created 1.04 xG vs 1.92 xG with him [15]

betting_insights.insight: 8/10 H2Hs saw BTTS (1.55 odds) [13]. Atlético's 67% home games & Real's 82% away UCL matches hit BTTS [3][5]
betting_insights.raw: xG models show 63% BTTS probability (+5% edge vs implied 64.5%) [3][15]

betting_insights.insight: Vinicius averages 0.48 xG/90 vs Atlético. Facing Molina (1.3 dribbled past/90), his 3.5 shot-creating actions/90 are key [2][15]
betting_insights.raw: Scored in 3 of last 4 derbies – all coming from left-wing carries [13]

betting_insights.insight: Derbies average 10.2 corners since 2023. Atlético's UCL home games average 5.1 corners for/4.2 against [14]
betting_insights.raw: Referee Szymon Marciniak awards 10.1 corners/game in UCL – 80th percentile [9]

prediction.reasoning: Atlético's home xG advantage (1.74 vs 1.17) and Real's UCL away overperformance (9 goals vs 7.3 xG) suggest a 2-1 regulation win for Atlético [3][5]. However, Real's aggregate lead and counter-attacking threat (4.3 fast breaks/90) likely see them through via away goals [1][6].

my_say.content: Under the Metropolitano lights, this derby transcends football – it's a chess match between Simeone's calculated chaos and Ancelotti's icy pragmatism. Watch for Bellingham's ghost runs into Atlético's midfield fissures, where Koke's aging legs meet Kroos' metronomic precision. The real battle? Griezmann's artful dodging versus Rüdiger's wrecking-ball physicality – a clash of styles as old as Madrid itself. With 16 European crowns whispering to Los Blancos and Atlético's 'never say die' ethos, expect 90 minutes where every clearance carries the weight of history. Don't blink when Vinícius hits fifth gear on the left – Molina's nightmares are made here. Strap in: this is Madridismo at its rawest, where xG models meet pure, unfiltered hate.
